title: Can my school see what I am doing on my phone if I am connected to their WiFi? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most likely the answer is yes. They can monitor the traffic and see what you've been searching. That said, unless you are searching some pretty heavy topics (stuff that definitely wouldn't fly with your parents), the chances of them noticing your traffic and looking into it would be slim to none. If you would like to combat them viewing your searches, you can use a VPN. I use a free VPN on my iPhone called FreeVPN. Watch an ad before connecting, then connect and enjoy (from what I've seen) unlimited data usage. Works for me at my school and is pretty fast too.

All depends on the network security systems and the firewalls they are using, however in this day and age I would assume that yes, they can. To be clear, we are talking internet activity/connections. Playing a game that doesn’t try to “call home” would not register on the monitoring system.
